p: (+)RNA viruses have adopted a mechanism of extensive rearrangement of intracellular membranes to provide a milieu for virus replication and assembly. This mechanism effectively protects dsRNA intermediates from degradation by the host cell machinery ( Delgui and Colombo, 2017, Jackson, 2014). This process has been well-documented for poliovirus, in which the newly formed membranous structures exclusively serve for virus production. Various types of vesicles that are formed upon viral infection have different roles in viral replication ( Rossignol et al., 2015).
